text:
While testing Appache HTTP Server on Windows Vista build 5215, our testers 
found the following problem:

x86/x64 Apache HTTP Server 2.0.54: Apache Service Monitor (ApacheMonitor.exe) 
does not like windows version

REPRO STEPS

1. Install Longhorn build 5215 on x86 machine.
2.	Log-in as local administrator.
3.	 Install Apache HTTP 2.0.54
4.	 See for error message.
5.	 Go to Start>Programs>Apache HTTP Server 2.0.54>Control Apache 
Server>Monitor Apache Servers, see for error message.
6.	 Restart machine, after logging in, see for error message.


Additional Info:
After  installation of apache HTTP Server, whenever System (itself) or user 
tries to open Apache Monitor, the error message pops saying “Operation 
completed successfully”. This same behavior happens for following three 
scenarios-
1. As soon as the installation completes.
2. Whenever user tries to open apache monitor from Start>Programs>Apache HTTP 
Server 2.0.54>Control Apache Server>Monitor Apache Servers.
This means that when we try to open Apache monitor it gives this error and we 
are unable to open the Apache monitor.
3. When logging on after System-restart.

Attachments: apache_bug.jpg


Results: After installation or when attempting to open apache monitor and 
also  after restart the same error message pops saying “Operation completed 
successfully”.

Expected Results: We should be able to open the apache monitor successfully in 
each case.

ACTION

This is informational only. Please refer to Windows Vista bug 1254088.

TESTERS NOTES

This application is installed with the Apache HTTP server and is used to 
monitor the  services and stop/start/restart the services.  If a WS03SP1 
version lie is applied to it the application launches and seems to function.

We generally don't shim server apps.
creator: a-mickel@microsoft.com

text:
Created attachment 16415
Graphic of error message
creator: a-mickel@microsoft.com

text:
Error "Operation completed successfully" indiciates the program is using
result code 0 as the error (S_OK, APR_SUCCESS or what have you.)  Although
I can't comment on Vista, I do expect to be able to report on Win 2003 SR2
shortly, and encourage anyone with some free cycles to look in the source
for any mismatch between the MessageBox error processing and passing an
uninitialized (or mismatched) error result variable to the function.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text: This has already been fixed across the board.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
